title: 113_hr3202
content: The Act is titled the "Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act" and includes a comprehensive security assessment of the Transportation Security Card Program. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in enhancing security for regulated facilities and vessels within one year of the Act's enactment. The Secretary of Homeland Security must conduct a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in addressing security risks in the maritime environment and addressing deficiencies identified by the Comptroller General. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a corrective action plan within 60 days of assessing the transportation security card program's effectiveness in addressing security risks and deficiencies identified by the Comptroller General. The plan must include an implementation plan with benchmarks. The corrective action plan for the transportation security card program must include an implementation plan with benchmarks and may involve programmatic reforms, regulatory revisions, or legislative proposals. The Comptroller General will review the plan within 120 days to assess its implementation of recommendations from the national laboratory or maritime security university-based center. The Secretary of Homeland Security must include recommendations from the Comptroller General in the corrective action plan for the transportation security card program. The final rule requiring the use of transportation security card readers cannot be issued until this plan is reviewed. The Secretary of Homeland Security must include Comptroller General recommendations in the corrective action plan for transportation security card readers. The final rule on card reader requirements is pending until the plan is reviewed. The Comptroller General will provide oversight on the corrective action plan for transportation security card readers, as per recommendations included in the final rule on card reader requirements. This oversight will occur every six months for a 3-year period following the issuance of the first report. The Comptroller General will report to relevant committees on the implementation of the corrective action plan for transportation security card readers. No additional funds are authorized for this Act and its amendments, using existing available amounts.
